website_summaries.verdict: Thanks to its wide range of content offerings--including Netflix, Amazon, Hulu Plus, and Pandora--the Roku XDS is the best all-around streaming media box you can get for less than $100.
pros: streams more than a hundred Internet video and audio services, including Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon, Pandora, Major League Baseball and NHL games, and Mediafly podcasts
works with all TVs, including non-HD models
upgradable firmware allows for periodic update of content and features
good HD video quality (on channels and programming that support it)
cons: Most worthwhile services require monthly or per-use fees
some game consoles and ever-cheaper Blu-ray players offer many of the same Internet-viewing options plus disc playback
currently offers no official support for streaming from USB drives and home network sources
video quality varies from channel to channel, depending upon provider and source material
setup and content queues usually require at least some PC interaction
yet another box under the TV
currently offers no access to PC- and USB-based media

customer_reviews.title: Crashes consistently, can't access new channels or recent software upgrades
customer_reviews.text: Everytime I watch a show on the Netflix or Amazon channels the Roku XD crashes. The good news it only happens once and after rebooting I can continue the program. This model has apparently been abandoned by Roku. If you want to access new channels like PBS, you will have to get a newer model. There is no technical reason for this, so boo on Roku for a slimy policy of forcing upgrades. This model also cannot receive new software updates. I suppose that could be due to technical limitations, but per above it's probably Roku trying to force us to buy another unit.
customer_reviews.author: Tim J.

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: The price was right and the quality is superb.It is fun to scan the many spots for entertainment. I have gone well into the wee hours of the mornings watching movies and cartoons. However--The setup was a terrifying ordeal. I chose the wireless setup using my router on my desktop computer. All went well until they asked for my 'encryption Code'.I thought those tech boys at Roku must be laughing in their egg noodle at that point. If it weren't for the furtive mind of my grandson I would have been the only resident in the neighborhood with a beautiful, one of a kind, Roku doorstop and this review would have gone in the negative direction.
customer_reviews.author: Old Codger

customer_reviews.title: simple + useful
customer_reviews.text: I like the Roku more than most products. It is physically small, reasonably inexpensive, solidly constructed, and fairly easy to set up. It's also so easy to use that my mother - who can barely figure out how to turn on a computer - was able to figure it out on her own. To me, that's impressive ease of use. The remote control is also quite a nice, elegantly minimal design. Mostly I use my Roku for Netflix. The app is well-made and the picture quality is always satisfactory and usually excellent (in HD). The Hulu+ app on the other hand is unspeakably bad software, but the picture still looks okay, so can't blame the Roku.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I know that there are newer models of Roku available, but I wanted to share that my Roku XD that I purchased 3 years ago is still going strong. I actually prefer it over the newer models since it has more audio and internet options in the back. For some reason. Roku keeps excluding features with each upgrade. The original Roku even had an optical out and I wish the newer ones did. I don't connect my Roku to a TV, I connect it to an Epson cinema projector for a home theater. I need to run my audio out of the Roku, It's also wired, which is sometimes a better option than wireless. I love my Roku!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Liberate yourself from the cable-industrial complex!
customer_reviews.text: For such a small sum, you can wirelessly stream Netflix, Crackle and private channels. I'm currently streaming Downton Abbey directly from PBS, so I can watch at my leisure, pause, etc., without having to record or be home at a certain time. Other good channels are ORA TV, esp if you miss Larry King, and Crackle is streaming Jerry Seinfeld's "Comics in Cars" series. For breaking news, there's SKY news. The list is getting bigger all the time. Other than my Netflix subscription, it's all free.
customer_reviews.author: musicreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Streaming ease
customer_reviews.text: The Roku 2050X XD Streaming Player lets us watch Netflix movies, listen to my Pandora Internet radio stations, and watch several other channels easily. The best part is that it's wireless so there were no ethernet cables to mess with. We just plugged it into the TV, followed some simple instructions and set up the account online, and we were in business. The quality is good, it's easy to use--just have yet one more remote to juggle. A much more affordable option than buying a new Blu-Ray player with streaming video. I'd recommend if you're just starting with streaming and don't' want to spend a ton of money on components.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B.

customer_reviews.title: Future Cable Killer Today
customer_reviews.text: Great with Netflix, Hulu and Crackle. Not so great with the news channels. As of now, you get pixels and broken pictures; it needs major picture quality improvements for the news channels. News should be recorded in at least Standard Definition if not HD. Netflix works flawlessly thru my iPhone, iPad along way to my PC/Mac and thru Roku to the TV. You can even control your Roku thru your iPhone using DVPRemote app. it works just fine. I am very happy with my purchase. I cancelled my cable and save $$$. This is the future, high speed internet hybrid with TV and all on demand.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jos

customer_reviews.title: Better than cable
customer_reviews.text: I finally got rid of my cable company!!! I went back to a roof antenna for local channels and the Roku box for Netflix. I have had the Roku for about 3 months now. I now watch Roku about 95% of the time. The ONLY complaint I have is that sometimes when you skip forward or back on a movie(when watching Netflix)it takes a long time to come back on. I also have Netflix streaming through the PS3 (basement) and skipping forward/back, the movie comes back instantly. So it is the Roku box. But this is a small complaint. All in all a great box. Tons of other channels. Easy to hook up.
customer_reviews.author: Buddyjay

customer_reviews.title: Great with 1 exception
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, small and light, not too expensive, portable. Q what else could you ask for right? A. Wifi that works. Because the wifi is useless. I suspect it will be hit or miss for most folks. It only sees my network every third time (and I have a newer Cisco Linksys dual ABG/N Router). I was only able to connect successfully once using wifi all other times it fails. Now I have it hardwired with a trendnet powerline adapter which works great. Bottom line: Am I happy with the product? Yes, but don't bother with the wifi version of the product.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: We Love Our Rokus!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Rokus - yes, plural. We purchased one during the holidays and since then have purchased another for our house and another as a gift for my brother. I love how easy it was to install and how easy it is to use. Netflix allows each account holder to stream content on up to six different devices, so we didn't even have to upgrade our Netflix account when we purchased the additional Roku. Also, the Channel Store on Roku is a wonderful place to explore - some channels are pay to play, some are free and some are a mixture of both. Hours of entertainment for a one-time flat price makes Roku a great value.
customer_reviews.author: planetdebz

customer_reviews.title: outstanding piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I had read about the Roku on Amazon, but was thinking about getting a game system instead. What was I thinking! The Roku is so easy to set up and use! Not only that, but the different channels available on the Roku are more than available on a game system. I had one probelm with the Roku connecting with my router, but when I called Roku troubleshooting, the woman on the phone was extremely knowledgeable and was able to get the problem resolved in a quick and efficient manner. I am more than pleased with Roku and recommend it to anyone that wants to watch streaming video on their TV.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy H

customer_reviews.title: CUT the CABLE NOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have finally joined the ranks of those cutting their cable TV shackles. The only issue I'm having is not being able to see Nascar Live at the moment; although, that aspect is getting worked on. Roku is an Excellent product and worth every penny you pay for it. Don't stress the required charge card entry aspect; it's there just in case you decide to subscribe to a "minority" of pay program stations out there. (I believe you can go in after wards and delete your card info; once you have signed up) The Majority of FREE stations and movies is UNBELIEVABLE!
customer_reviews.author: K. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Good product for good price.
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well. It picks up hd on netflix and others perfectly off of wireless connection. Has plenty of channels and able to download several private channels. Works very well for receiving netflix, hulu plus and others. The only problem I have had is that several times the channel store will not come up. It says there is a internet problem. However, everything else works perfectly. I then need to restart the roku, and the channel store then works. I have downloaded all channels I am interested in, so this is just a minor inconvenience. Overall I am very happy with the product and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: No PC needed
customer_reviews.text: Just a boardband connection, mine is 3mps, and a netflix account and that's it. Netflix is an unbelievable deal in these contempoary times. Hulu plus is coming soon but it's a dollar more a month than netflix, has far far less to offer, and commercials that popped up every 7 minutes when I tried it for a month. They should pay you. Oh, this is owned by Rupert Murdock the guy who owns Fox News and pays Shephard Smith 7 million dollars a year net to comment on California car chases, so now you know why the commercials are so long and annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Saxon

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about 4-5 years so far. Used almost every day for 2-3 years and now used a little more sparingly as it's not with the primary TV anymore. As far as the device, it's built to last a very long time. I would recommend getting a newer model though because i don't think they support this anymore. A couple of the apps are no longer on here. But overall, it was a fantastic purchase.
customer_reviews.author: pa.lion

customer_reviews.title: I like this Roku player because it isn't wifi
customer_reviews.text: I like this Roku player because it isn't wifi. I don't get good wifi reception. This Roku was working fine when I first got it. After about two weeks it started playing shows when the TV is off. Almost everyday, when I turn my TV on, it is frozen in the middle of a show that is on my que. It is weird that it doesn't do it everyday, but it is still irritating. Maybe it's a problem with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roku HD
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Roku HD for my wife as a Christmas present. I have it connected with an ethernet cable. It works great! It was easy to set up - the unit puts an activation code on the tv screen, then you go to your computer, go to the Roku website and enter the activation code. By the time you get back to the TV the Roku HD is activated. Couldn't be easier. I didn't try the wireless connection as I feel that wired will provide more bandwidth. There are plenty of non pay sites to view on the Roku service. My wife primarily uses our Netflix subscription on the Roku. Seems like a good purchase for us.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: works w/older tv
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of paying a big cable bill but wanted more choices than the basic CBS, NBC, ABC, FOX, and CW. Alot of video streaming boxes only come with a HDMI port. My TVs are over 10 years old, therefore no HDMI port. I'm an accountant and my cost analysis didn't justify replacing a TV. The Roku XD worked with either an HDMI or RCA cable (red/yellow/white-composite video and analog audio). This was the deciding factor on my purchase. I have been very pleased with this purchase. It was easy to set up, works without any problems, and will pay for itself in less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: djb45

customer_reviews.title: Done with Roku due to poor customer support.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 5 or 6 Rokus but have become dissatisfied with their lack of customer service. Their off shore support is really frustrating. I lost track of the number of times I had to describe the same problem to one ill-trained 'tech' after another. Thankfully, streaming device choices have increased from when Roku might have been considered a leader. Chrome and Apple come to mind, the latter having a great reputation for excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Benchracer

customer_reviews.title: Great way to stream Netflix
customer_reviews.text: I acquired the Roku player after becoming frustrated with the frequent failures of newest generation Apple TV, and the inability of Apple support specialists to identify solutions. I needed customer service to install the Roku player, but it has been totally reliable during the past 3 months of use. Roku customer service was excellent. Based on my experience with Apple TV and Roku, I believe that the Roku is far superior to Apple TV for streaming Netflix. I have not used either device for any other application, so my strong preference for Roku is based exclusively on Netflix streaming.
customer_reviews.author: BoB

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment for Streaming
customer_reviews.text: I am both a Netflix and an Amazon Prime member. I took the plunge into streaming with some trepidation, but was tired of watching streaming videos on my computer. I LOVE my roku box. Set-up was easy and required only one support call to roku to tweak my router settings. The streaming is fast and high quality. The remote is easy to use and almost a year later the roku is still going strong. I even got to cut down my cable costs significantly. What more can you ask? Very pleased with this purchase and highly recommend the roku boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia McPherson

customer_reviews.title: Great little device
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I am an apple guy and at first was thinking of getting the apple tv...until I did some reasearch. Roku has many more applications than apple, and they don't charge for everything like apple seems to want to do. I was very pleasantly surprised at the number of applications you can download (most are free) to allow you to get other shows, and the quality of video and ease of use is great. We have cancelled our Dish Network plan (tired of paying the expensive fees) and are using Netflix (less than $10) and Hulu etc...I bought 2 more units for other rooms so now, let the savings begin.
customer_reviews.author: P. NORMAN

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!  Minimal remote.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this box. Gave up on TiVo and went with the cable box and lost Amazon VOD and Netflix. Works just great and is fully compatable with the Amazon Prime free streaming content. I have 15 Mbps Internet and wireless N router. Had to program my Harmony One remote manually though because most of the buttons didn't program automatically though the device is in the database under DVRs or home media PCs strangely. You would think that Logitech would have a category for these things by now. They need to get with the times... Buy this box.
customer_reviews.author: Benegesserit

customer_reviews.title: My favorite new toy
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of content you can watch instantly on your TV if you have a Netflix account. The Roku is so easy to set up and so easy to use. I am using a wireless internet connection, so any connectivity issues I've had I blame on my internet connection, not the Roku. The shows/movies download so fast! The picture and sound quality are excellent! Besides Netflix, you can use Pandora or a bunch of other interesting radio stations. There are news programs (the regulars plus Al-Jazeera English), and other things you pay extra for, such as Hulu and Amazon Prime. I may never leave my couch.
customer_reviews.author: JulietW

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I really love the option of watching my video on demand episodes on my tv. This works great for that. I needed customer service to help set it up and within 5 minutes It was up ad running. It lets you watch from many diffrent places not just amazon.com I am thinking of getting more for our other tv's. so I can watch video's in other rooms to. It is awesome that all of my episodes are organized and ready to play. No searching for the dvd to watch what you want. :)
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: I love this so much, I will be buying these as Xmas Gifts!
customer_reviews.text: I'm becoming a couch potato again! I'm finding it hard to get the honey-do's done now since I bought a Roku box. With Netflix you will find yourself never looking at your cable channels again. the speed and picture quality is actually better than my crappy cable company fuzzy signal. Out side if Netflix I have found myself digging through all of the other channels included with the unit. My only reason to get one of these was to watch Leo Leporte's TWIT TV vidcasts and I have yet to even look into that yet with all of the other stuff that's available.
customer_reviews.author: Big Cat Catcher

customer_reviews.title: Exceeding my expecations
customer_reviews.text: I've had two Roku XD players for a few months, and the performance of these devices has exceeded my expectations. The reason I bought the Roku players was to provide an alternative to my increasingly costly cable service. So, instead of paying nearly $90 / month for HQ cable, I now watch streaming content (Netflix) and listen to Pandora - both of which are an improvement over my previous cable service. Further, I reduced my monthly cable payments by nearly forty dollars (going to just "basic"), savings that will soon pay for the Roku players. These devices are definitely worth the small price.
customer_reviews.author: The Oracle

customer_reviews.title: Great even for those of us with sluggish connections
customer_reviews.text: I love this little device which makes cable obsolete and allows me to stream everything from movies to workouts to my TV. I was concerned my slowish DSL + wifi would make this challenging but either the device and/or streaming source (Netflix, Amazon, etc.) adapt as I have great quality streaming. I hate setting things up without the help of folks skilled in this arena. But I set this one up sans assistance in less than 12 minutes. Super easy and intuitive. For a couple months of cable bills, you can start controlling your own programming. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: LE P. Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment - UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: Just got this little box and had it working within 15 minutes, including getting connected to my Netflix account. Set it on HD video and was very impressed with the quality of the video. Was using my playstation 3 for Netflix, but the video from this little box is far better for HD programming. Since DVD's will soon be the thing of the past, and video streaming will be the future, the Roku will get you started very nicely. UPDATE: Although this little box streams in 1080p, it does NOT stream the audio in 5.1 dolby sound. ONLY in stereo.
customer_reviews.author: Compy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Setup..... More Apps Needed
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I purchased this to watch many apps such as netflix, willow tv and some regional applications from india. I think this is a great buy for people across the globe as i see there are quite a few apps from different languages. Pros: easy to setup, fast to download apps cons: no youtube, both wireless and wired work the same speed as i expected with wired it would be much faster, often i get "loading please wait.." may be due to the internet speed. I do have a comcast cable internet with 22 MBPS download speeds.... Overall its worth the price as I stream netflix, willow tv and couple of apps from india...
customer_reviews.author: sp20100930

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy!!
customer_reviews.text: This is crap!! Old. No storage I can't get half of the channels I want. I am so disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom V.

customer_reviews.title: NetFlix streaming is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I own the latest Apple TV and this Roku XD. THis does some things the Apple TV won't do and the Apple TV does some things this won't. THe Netflix streaming at this point is much better than Apple but the Apple TV menu's are far superior. Documentation is a little vague especially when your trying to figure out how to get the amazon, pandora and netflix codes. This won't stream your music or movies, that's where Apple comes up strong. If I could combine these 2, I'd have a killer entertainment system. THe price of $79 is a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: kdoug

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Roku box. The first is 720p, since it is on an older HDTV. This is 1080p on a newer, but slightly smaller HDTV. The bottom line is: they work as advertised, and the price is ridiculously low. If you think you want one, buy one. I gave up cable TV a while back and use mostly Netflix streaming and Hulu Plus, both on the Roku. More than enough boob tube for me. Now when I travel, I am disappointed because all I have is the regular TV in the hotel. Compared to what I can get on the Roku, TV sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Sean P. Moran

customer_reviews.title: IN LOVE WITH IT!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. We have had Netflix over 2 years running through a DVD player in our bedroom. We have 2 girls who were starting to show a preference in certain cartoons. They were constantly in our bedroom watching their shows. We thought we would buy a streaming player for our front room and t has been wonderful. It is much faster than my DVD player, picture quality is better. I LOVE IT!!!! Well worth the money and the extra buttons on the remote were a little expensive I think but we do use them so worth the extra expense.
customer_reviews.author: Meli

customer_reviews.title: Should have gotten it a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: While there isn't much, that I enjoy, of the free content, I do wish I had bought this earlier. Some of the channels are a lot of fun and it is often pretty decent quality. It was a bit of a pain to install, simply due to the set-up we have, but it was worth it. It responds quickly to commands, and so easy to use that even children won't have any problems. For those of us without expensive gaming systems that we simply wouldn't play, this little entertainment device is a nice treat.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Condition as described/fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this for my dad so that I could have the Playstation 3 back. He doesn't know it yet as it's a Christmas present. I know he's going to love it. The shipping was very fast! I got it within a week of ordering it. The condition of it? Just as described. In its original box, with the manual, and everything was wrapped up -- not just placed in the box (i bought it used). This seller took really good care of the Roku, which I really appreciate! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We've got a Wii and a Vizio TV with VIA Apps, and they're OK, but they don't hold a candle to the Roku box. If I were doing it today, I would get the Roku 2, mainly for the ability to get subtitles, but the sheer number of channels on the Roku is amazing. It does great HD, even over 802.11G Wifi at a fair distance from the router, which really impressed me. This reminds me a lot of the Tivo when it came out; it's a streaming video appliance done right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Excellent, Excellent
customer_reviews.text: One step closer to cutting the ties to Cable. This worked right out of the box. Connection was a piece of cake. I didn't even realize that I could play my Amazon VOD library, so I was able to test it out by watching a movie. I have DSL, not the fast version, and it works just fine. I'm watching a video now while typing this review with no noticable lag. I don't know what would happen if there were a couple of Roku's trying to access at the same time, but for me, it's not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Aramat

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good price, small
customer_reviews.text: Works Great. Well-priced solution. Small. Have not had a hiccup yet in video streaming performance over my wireless-N network. Picture Quality on Netflix using Roku XD is definitely better than on the Wii, espcially when the source material is HD. I don't like the quality of Netflix on Wii on my 52" Samsung LCD but the Roku is much more tolerable. I have not compared the picture quality with any of the Netflix-equipped blu-ray players which have the potential to have even better picture quality (if they have superior upsampling processors). If you are a videophile then you probably will want the Oppo Digital BDP-93 to stream Netflix but that costs almost 10 times more ($500)
customer_reviews.author: AudioNutty

customer_reviews.title: No problems with ATT Uverse 3Mbps
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit for a 3rd (basement) basic TV in our exercise room. I had doubts it would work as this unit is downstairs at the other end of the house from the router and I have the lower speed DSL at 3Mbps. As others have said, you do have to enter a credit card number but I don't see that as a big deal. Installation was easy without any problems. Netflix streaming works well with no problems. I like this unit better than my Samsung C6500 Blu-Ray for streaming. Good menus and interface.
customer_reviews.author: nunyabisness

customer_reviews.title: A Great Netflix companion...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Super easy to use, you can use wired/wireless internet with it. Setup is so easy. The "go Back" button is so cool when you're watching online videos. The unit is so tiny and it uses very little power, I can hide this thing pretty much anywhere. Con: Doesn't come with HDMI cable....It does come with RCA cables, but really! the point of buying this thing is to watch in HD. Do yourself a favor and get some HDMI cables if you own a tv without fake wood sidings.
customer_reviews.author: Tonosama Ishikawa

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This thing was great when I used it. I bought it specifically for the purpose of watching mlb.tv on my big screen and it worked perfectly for this. Once the app became available for the Xbox 360, I lost my need for the Roku. So if you don't have a Smart TV, smart blu-ray player, XBox 360/One or PS3/4, and want to watch Netflix, Hulu Plus, and other apps on your tv, the Roku is a great option!
customer_reviews.author: Lance & Amy

customer_reviews.title: Roku on Wifi
customer_reviews.text: I was really skeptic of this thing because my Wifi is kinda weak but it works great without a glitch. I wish there was more to pick from on Netflix. I was a blockbuster guy before and you can't watch the Blockbuster on demand stuff on it yet. I was thinking about getting the Hulu plus so I could see a lot more TV programs but it doesn't seem to have anything that I'm interested in watching and isn't already on Netflix. The machine is really cool though, I bought one for my neighbor and one for my little sister. Everybody's really happy with them and everybody is running them on Wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Get device
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during the promo period thinking I would just try it. This little thing is great,it streams netflix and Amazon VOD no problem. Much better user interface than Wii or LG blu-ray player, you can browse movies right from your sofa.The only down side is I dont know how long the ROKU brand/device will last mainly because newer TVs & blu-ray players have this technology built in.......But it is cheaper than a Blu-ray and TV, so maybe it will be around awhile. Overall I say worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: RDRCA

customer_reviews.title: Not regretting one bit of my purchace, but wishing for more.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little box with everything I have. I don't have the money for cable but since I wanted Netflix I thought I would buy myself a present for Christmas too. I wish it worked like the XBox Netflix though, you have to add movies to your queue on the computer before you can view them on your Roku player, which is disappointing. But other than that all of the private channels and hours worth of things to watch and music to listen to, I think I will be set through a few years of college.
customer_reviews.author: jb2009

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Rokus! I got 2, one for the living room and one for the bedroom. I am completely cable free since the cable prices these days are highway robbery. Roku is how I get my entertainment to the TV and stay sane. I am a gadget person but my partner is not. However she can work it without any training or baby-sitting, which, honestly, has probably saved our relationship! LOL I have the Netflix and Hulu Plus subscriptions. My Amazon VOD purchases are flawless. I also was able to add a channel for PlayOn. I have everything I need and will never look back!
customer_reviews.author: N. Sands

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: My family and I love our Roku XD, nice selection of free channels and the wireless streaming for most channels is totally seamless. We purchased this unit primarily for the ease of finding movies thru Netflix/Amazon for our young grandchildren when they visit and we certainly have not been disappointed. we have been very pleasantly surprised with all the additional content, I'm watching and old episode of Amos and Andy on it as I type this review. So easy to use our 4 year old grandson can use it himself to find what shows he wants to watch. I definitely recommend Roku and will be buying more units as gifts for my family.
customer_reviews.author: uvahoosfan

customer_reviews.title: Roku works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for myself and fell in love with how easy it is to set up and use. Loved it so much I bought more as gifts for favorite people and will buy still more to replace cable/satellite boxes in guest rooms. Why pay monthly for boxes that will rarely be used when I can make such an inexpensive investment that will allow my guests to find amusing and interesting videos to watch while visiting my home. Saves me lots of $$$ and gives my friends and family a great new experience.
customer_reviews.author: zTOT

customer_reviews.title: Done with Roku
customer_reviews.text: I was willing to put up with frequent freezing. Because they had a large content variety of independent providers. But now, they have kicked out all foreign language streaming to make way for the lousy Dish Networks programming instead. Technically, setup is simple. But constant freezing and rebooting was annoying. Reason I picked Roku over AppleTV was precisely because I didnt want the controlling big-brother attitude. Roku is fast morphing into another cable - goodbye.
customer_reviews.author: RealDeal

customer_reviews.title: Roku is a wow
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up and use. I took it out of the box, hooked it up to the TV, and plugged it into the AC outlet. The unit connected with my WIFI and its software was upgraded. I used my laptop to open a Netflix account. In less than ten minutes I was watching Columbo season one. The unit runs better than expected. I dropped the premium cable movie channels; I should save $80.00 a month- it pays for itself in one month. I am getting two more units for my other televisions.
customer_reviews.author: MrFinns

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Device
customer_reviews.text: The Roku XD is an awesome little device. For $80 plug the cost of a bunch of services that I'm already subscribed to I get HD video and 5.1 surround sound with no discs and a very simple interface. It has all of the channels I want (and no other device does): Amazon Instance Video, Netflix, Hulu Plus, and MLB.TV. I wish the UI was a bit more responsive, but it's not bad (WAY better than TiVo) and a great deal at $80 (You can get the base version for only $50!). Awesome device and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my folks for Christmas along with a Netflix subscription. I got it set up and running which was fairly easy and I believe they could have figured it out on their own. They absolutely love it and find it easy to use. I played around with it and it is perfect for those of you who do not own a game console or media PC to stream your media. Along with Netflix and Amazon Video on Demand, they have channels you can stream from several other online providers.
customer_reviews.author: L3rob

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews on here I was worried I wouldn't be able to connect using WIFI with my Roku but I had absolutely no problem at all. The picture is awesome I never have issues with it buffering or timing out. The only thing I would ask for is a power button (or am I missing it somewhere?). The netflix and Amazon Video on Demand are the only channels I have used so far but I like that the Roku has different selections. I would definitely buy this little box again!
customer_reviews.author: Bigskygirl

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, on-line video says to hit re-set button of which there is not on this unit
customer_reviews.text: Read review here on Amazon saying the newest model is not "new and improved" and actually had key features removed. Recommendation was to get this specific model, which can be gotten only as a used item. That's where I went wrong. Doesn't work, on-line video says to hit re-set button of which there is not on this unit. Never buy unless brand new and don't believe what's said in reviews. Caveat Emptor!
customer_reviews.author: JcMMc

customer_reviews.title: Great Got Greater
customer_reviews.text: There are tons of positive reviews on here and this is another one. Honestly this little box is a great deal if you have Netflix. If you don't have netflix, you should get this thing, and then get netflix. The fact the there is so much more you can do with it (ie: pandora, Amazon on Demand, College Lectures, and sooo much more) is just icing on the cake. I am eager awaiting Hulu Plus as an addition (coming soon). Between that and Netflix, I should be able to drop the cable bill.
customer_reviews.author: Pincoat

customer_reviews.title: So easy to setup and great performance
customer_reviews.text: It is so easy to setup the device and get it connected to WIFI. In less than 15 minutes, I got the devices connected to the TV and my home WIFI with security. It took us another 5 minutes to setup the Roku with NetFlix and Amazon Video and we are ready to go. The only Cons is that it should come with FREE Hulu so I can watch some TV Shows before making any purchase. I love it when a product is so easy to setup and does not require any instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: Samsudin

customer_reviews.title: Nice but pauses movies to lower quality
customer_reviews.text: The best part about this box is that it can hook up to an older TV that doesn't support HDMI. If my TV had HDMI, I think I would have purchased the Apple TV box instead. Almost every time I am watching a movie, the movie will pause and it will fill the buffer, but then it lowers the quality of the movie from 4 to 2. This maybe Netflix, but I think it has to do with the box. It stinks that they didn't add an on/off button, so I keep unplugging it. Nice otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cut the Cable Cord!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Roku with the intention of lowering our cable bills and it definitely delivers on that aspect. I already had a Netflix subscription, and we added a HuluPlus subscription and now we pay about $70/mo. (including internet access) instead of over $200! Check out the websites of Netflix and Hulu 1st, though, to make sure the shows you want are available. And remember that ONLY HuluPlus offerings are available on the Roku, NOT regular Hulu programming.
customer_reviews.author: Gem B

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents for Christmas along with a year of Netflixs. My parents are 70 so I wanted something easy for them to use. This item fit the bill perfect. I set this up for them and I took 15 minutes explaining how it worked and off they went with no problems. It is not rocket science setting it up but I would suggest you have a good working knowledge of computers. If you don't then call the neighborhood wiz kid and pay them to do it for you.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: So Much Better Than Cable
customer_reviews.text: We finally made the switch from cable to the Roku Streaming player. For what it does, it does it perfectly. Must-have subscriptions to accompany this device: Netflix for movies and older TV shows and Hulu Plus for some brand new shows. You might also consider getting Amazon prime. They have a growing collection. I also recommend getting an HD antenna and hooking it up in your attic so that your TV gets some live local channels. The Roku doesn't provide any content for live local TV coverage (weather, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: It was top notch in it's day and still working great!
customer_reviews.text: Ah, the original Roku streaming player. I have since purchased a Roku 2 and a Fire TV stick. However, this device still gets used. It's a bit slower than the others, due to technology. Not a downside for when it was released. It was top notch in it's day and still working great!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: The Roku is awesome!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is really an awesome product for the price. Installation is so easy and it only took about 5 minutes. With having access to Netflix and Hulu Plus, we cancelled our cable service and couldn't be happier about that. This little box gives you so many free programming is crazy! Cooking shows, news, cartoons for the kids, and plus if you subcribe to netflix (9.99 a month starting on Jan 2011) and Hulu Plus (8.99 a month) you choices are endless. I can't believe that out TV bill is only $19.00 a month. We don't have to pay for unnecessary programming, we pay for what we need. It's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: ginette

customer_reviews.title: I like ROKU XD
customer_reviews.text: My Roku XD arrived about 2 hrs ago and is now up an running. I used a wired connection to my FIOS router and while I have a Sony Bravia 40" HDTV, I elected, because of my cabling situation, to temporarily connect via the RCA connectors. I am currently watching a 1958 black and white Toshiro Mifune movie on Netflix and everything works fine. I like the unit so far. Selecting movies from my Netflix Instant Watch list is easy and straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: PghMike

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and easy to hide
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great for netflix and MLB streaming and all the others. It was buggy for me on my wireless for some reason, so I plug it in with an Ethernet cable. I didn't bother to troubleshoot why the connection to my wireless was dropping in an out since my cable modem was right there on a desk behind my TV. Amazon has such a great return policy that didn't worry about giving this Roku box a try. If you don't like it, Amazon will take it right back so no risk to me.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: ROKU is Great!
customer_reviews.text: Got this device because we love to watch movies without commercials and we also have a NETFLIX account. This unit setup quickly and since our unit is only 15 feet away from our wireless router the download stream is fast and clear. This is the Future! Recommended to all..only one issue but will probably be resolved soon..the Movie Titles are older than the ones we would normally get from Netflix DVD..but they are adding more selections all the time..
customer_reviews.author: Dave W

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity at it's best.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to stream netflix to my tv. It was the cheapest possible device to do so, and it works great. Ridiculously easy to install and set up. If you can insert a plug and read at a 2nd grade level, you can do it. The picture looks great on my 10 year old tv, so I can only imagine how it looks on a nice tv. Definitely worth the money if you need to stream netflix. Haven't gotten around to working with the other channels, but I will eventually. But honestly, all I cared about was netflix, so even if they're no good, it's still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia DiMauro

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product that works as advertised. It takes a little effort to get everything set-up, but you just need to follow the on screen instructions and get accounts online set-up for both Roku and services like Pandora. I had one minor issue that was probably self induced after multiple "quick" song skips that ultimately locked up my Roku set-up. But it was solved by redoing the set-up of the Roku and everything has worked normal ever since.
customer_reviews.author: DIYer

customer_reviews.title: Work-around for Youtube ...
customer_reviews.text: Most people have written great reviews about Roku .. and I agree its a great device. More recently, Roku's private channel on Youtube was taken off, so new Roku buyers cannot have Youtube any more. That is mostly true as of now - expect I googled a Work-around. Go to [...]. The free version of the software can give you reliable Youtube access on your Roku by turning you PC/Laptop into a media-server. Not the neatest solution, but surely something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roku XD Streaming Player 1080p
customer_reviews.text: Order came quickly and was to specs. I had to wait almost a month to get an HDMI cable and an HDMI switch since my TV had only two HDMI inputs and I already had a cable box and a blu-ray player connected to the TV. However, once I got those and installed the Roku player, the setup went quickly and I was almost immediately streaming from my NetFlix and Amazon Prime accounts. Great product, great price, great seller!
customer_reviews.author: Denise "AintNoNinny"

customer_reviews.title: No more huge cable bills & still nothing to watch!
customer_reviews.text: I finally took the plunge. I kept hearing happy customers telling of their happiness with the device & with getting rid of cable bills or "dish" bills. I'm favorably impressed. I can watch pretty much what I want, when I want & the service providing it is only costing me about $8 a month. That sure beats about $60 a month for barely more than basic cable & so little available on it that I watched about 3 hours a week! Well worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: undisclosed

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my elderly parents and they LOVE IT!!! This coupled with their minimum NETFLIX membership has provided them with hours and hours of inexpensive entertainment. The quality of the picture and sound is wonderful. Set this up with a wireless internet connection and it works great. The 1st one did not work properly, but Amazon replaced it immediately and the 2nd one works like a champ! Would highly reccommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Movie Watcher

customer_reviews.title: Very cool product = just needs more plugs
customer_reviews.text: Having gotten tired of watching netflix on my laptop, we finally broke down and got the Roku. It is very cool! Does exactly what it says it does. Streaming Netflix is a breeze. Picture quality is good as is sound. Set up is also extremely easy. One drawback is that it only has RCA cables out and not a set to go in. So if you have a DVD player you need to either continuously hook and unhook cables or buy a router. I just ordered one so should solve the problem. People at Roku - please please give us an in and out just like a DVD player!
customer_reviews.author: rlmnyc

customer_reviews.title: Just to add to the 5 stars here
customer_reviews.text: Figure this is 1 review in a sea of 5 stars, but thats what I rely on when making purchases, and this was no exception. I had some wireless issues, but ran a cat5 cable and this thing works like champ. I use netflix and have been gravitating toward discovery channel shows for me and my 7 year old. Nothing like a huge library of great content to get me to consider canceling cable. (its just a matter of time) Thanks Roku! 5 Stars
customer_reviews.author: awnold

customer_reviews.title: Roku OK but Loves Batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Runs OK, but if you use the earbuds, it EATS the batteries. Make sure you have plenty of AA's on hand. Unit gets hot to the touch also. Otherwise it works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Ingle

customer_reviews.title: roku video
customer_reviews.text: This item is simple to use and setup. However, there are several interruptions during the course of watching a movie. It seems to drop the streaming video signal and then recover it. Movie menu is somewhat old and obsolete. There are to many foreign movies with english subtitles---not to my liking. There are, however, some travel documentaries that are very educational to me. I enjoy watching documentaries.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hal

customer_reviews.title: Old
customer_reviews.text: Only halfways works when it wants to. Remote and tv doesn’t respond
customer_reviews.author: KellyEkleberry

customer_reviews.title: A world of entertainment in a tiny box!
customer_reviews.text: Quite simple, as anybody who's used one will attest to. If anything involving connections between home entertainment appliances annoys you, ask your 12-year old nephew for help. Really, its simple. The Roku has proven to be very reliable, as 37 months of uninterrupted service confirm. Do I recommend this item? Whole-heartedly! Now it’s even better, with the release of Roku 2 XD.
customer_reviews.author: SF Danner

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my Roku and Netflix
customer_reviews.text: The Roku is hands down the best electronic device I have ever purchased. Easy to setup and easy to set up with Netflix also. Roku is always ading new links, including many free ones. I use the Pandora radio setup for music, and love being able to watch my Picasa web pictures with a few clicks of the remote. I have recommended the Roku/Netflix combo to many friends. Also, buying from Amazon was so easy--Great folks to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Butch

customer_reviews.title: Roku Makes Me Happy
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing!!! I use it to stream netflix, hulu, amazon video and pandora. The picture quality is as good as the video quality you are streaming. My TV is an older one from 2007 with a 720p picture quality but everything still looks and sounds great. I got a basic $10 antenna to go with the Roku, and now with this device & broadcast TV, I have said goodbye to cable. You definitely won't regret getting it!
customer_reviews.author: yelhsa

customer_reviews.title: Wow! This thing works great. Roku XD
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This thing works great. I've been using a computer to watch Netflix movies. The Roku XD I just received works much better even with my kind of slow DSL connection. There are many more channels than are shown on the Roku site once you get it online. The music channels are awesome. Only downfall was the actual getting it to work the first time but it was well worth the effort. Be patient. The software update takes awhile. The price is hard to believe its so low.
customer_reviews.author: OzzyB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: My roku box is one of my most favorite electronic items and I am a geek. I have two of these units one for the bedroom and one in the living room. The roku has helped me get rid of cable and access my content on demand. I use both wirelessly and I rarely ever have any issues. I love how easy this is to use as my non geek friends pick up the remote and have no issue navigating around. The roku box is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: S. Paine

customer_reviews.title: Roku 730p Streaming Player
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for several years and it works just fine. I listen to Pandora, watch Netflix and Amazon on my television (HD), to which I have the Roku hooked up. I have wireless DSL so that I do not have to have the Roku attached to anything except the power outlet and the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Dyana

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Got one for my mom for her birthday along with a Netflix subscription. She has Cable internet, took a little bit to setup, didn't seem super speedy but great if you are patient. Video streamed great, no problems. Got one for myself a few days ago, we have FIOS internet 15mbps. Setup took about 5 minutes. NO problems at all, LOVE it. I will get getting rid of expensive cable very soon and saving about $50 a month.
customer_reviews.author: T.A.R.

customer_reviews.title: Some streaming video kinks with Netflix
customer_reviews.text: The Roku is a low-cost option to have streaming video from the internet, provided that you are OK with the available channels. It does not provide the ability to freely choose from any available internet site with video, only those sites that are programmed compatible with the Roku. The big sell for Roku is the partnership with Netflix. However, there are kinks with the video streamed from Netflix ranging from download interruptions or no connectivity at all, especially in the evening hours. According to a forum on Roku, the problem is being investigated but as of March 12, 2011 there has been nothing communicated from Roku about it.
customer_reviews.author: DJ DeSpain

customer_reviews.title: Performance for the price is excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Set up was as easy as it can be for on screen keyboard style systems. Integrated into my Samsung HDTV and several others with no issues. Integrated into my Linksys Wireless LAN easily. Video is good. Integration with Netflix is good. Audio feeds into my stereo nicely (TV audio and online radio stations). Nice size for transporting between TV's in different rooms.
customer_reviews.author: jimeagle

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Buy and easy to use right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted to buy a product like this but didn't want to spend a fortune and didn't want a difficult product to keep up and running. Roku and Amazon made all of this possible with a great price and easy use. I was up and running in less than 15 minutes with only one slight hitch. It didn't like my security code but finally accepted it and "bingo" I had a wonderful picture that even my wife can control. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Moore

customer_reviews.title: Video Bliss
customer_reviews.text: I dropped my Charter cable TV service and replaced it with a Roku XD. This gadget rocks! Easy to set up, easy to use, and a bizillion viewing choices. Between my Netflix, Amazon Prime and Hulu Plus I have way more than enough to keep me staring at the TV. But I stare when I want, no more scheduled programming, I just pause & go as I please. Highly recommended... I even bought one for my boyfriend! :)
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Video Streaming Player at affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Great video streaming player for streaming Netflix and 100s of other video content.. Especially for straming Netflix, it if 1000 times better than the options available with my TV & BluRay player, where u can't browse movies.. And there are many FREE south asian/Indian channels/movies available thru Channel Live, TamilIP TV, TimesNow etc. Its not just a player, it is a platform for future internet video streaming. Great Produce, you can't go wrong with this. Best value for money.... highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Vasan

customer_reviews.title: great choice
customer_reviews.text: I'm so pleased at the results I've had with my Roku 2050X XD. I had it was up and running in no time. The results I see on my HDTV are outstanding and I'm not even using the HDMI connection. It's amazing to see all the channels/streaming sights that appear on my menu. I'm using Netflix instant video's and the best part is you can look at all the movies available and put what you want to watch in an"instant Queue". That beats looking at a couple of thousand movies everytime you want to view one.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Prudhomme

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: We don't use the free apps a lot (pandora sometimes), but the Netflix $8/month subscription is great. They have a ton of on demand kids shows (Dora, Thomas, ...) that the kids love. The tv isn't our baby sitter, but its nice to have kid shows ready for downtime w/o having to go the Cable DVR $70/month route. We also enjoy the regular Netflix movies available (on demand and dvd), but the kids programming alone was worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Saal

customer_reviews.title: Slow DSL and netflix
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Roku XD player 12/2010 and it works great. I have Netflix and the slowest DSL speed 763mb and it works good enough for my viewing with two quality dots. If I had faster DSL it would be better, but I don't have a HD TV and it's not worth an extra $15 a month for faster DSL. I wired it to a router with an ethernet cable instead of a wireless router and that helps the picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great value
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It was very easy to set up and it works extremely well - fast and easy to use. The interface is clear and looks nice. The box itself is small, tidy looking and silent. The remote has an 8 second instant replay that is an excellent feature. This remote is the reason I got the XD instead of the cheaper HD, and I'm very glad I did. The main thing wrong with this product is that it makes me regret getting a Boxee box - now that I have a Roku, I realise that for my purposes, it is better and quieter than the Boxee and half the price.
customer_reviews.author: steelpaw

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am quite happy with my roku box, so far so good. The video quality is great and have had no problems with sound. I wish there were more apps available but Netflix, Amazon Video and Hulu are more than enough I suppose. They do indeed request your credit card info at the beginning which makes no sense, but you get what you pay for I guess. I will update this review later.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install & use - love it!
customer_reviews.text: A friend turned me on to the Roku XD when I disconnected satellite TV. He recommended Netflix as an alternative and the Roku as a great way to stream. It was simple enough I could hook it up myself and it is simple to operate. I'm very pleased with this product and would recommend to anyone who is looking for an inexpensive alternative to some of the other streaming devices, such as the Wii.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.text: If you have or are thinking about getting Netflix, this is a much cheaper way to go than buying a Wii or other gaming device. If you already have a gaming device do not buy a Roku because your device is already compatible with Netflix to watch streaming video. However, Roku devices can do more than link to your Netflix. They now offer Hulu Plus, which allows you to stream on demand almost any TV show you wish to watch. Hopefully soon, Netflix and Hulu will expand their choices even further so that I can cancel my satellite TV - one less monthly bill!
customer_reviews.author: Adam V.

customer_reviews.title: Roku, the original and champ for television!
customer_reviews.text: Roku is the best little device if using for Netflix, Amazon, etc. Though the UI is now dated, the device works great for streaming. This older version does not have any fancy keyboard and the UI can be a bit slow compared to using to more expensive devices like an xbox, newer Roku, etc. Yet, what ain't broken is still giving hours of entertaiment and has been one of the best gifts I've ever given to my family.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Nosek

customer_reviews.title: A good device for streaming
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality and streaming was good. Amazon Instant video quality was great. Lots of content. My concerns with this product were 1. When First started it asked me to update the software. Upgrade took a long time and many retrys to complete. It took me atleast 30 - 40 retrys to get the software upgraded. 2. customer_reviews.author: ROHIT

customer_reviews.title: Tech for my Parents
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Technology-phobic parents. After a little bit of setup had the netflix streaming up and running. The setup was easy, but not easy enough that my parents would have done it without me. The roku box was small and does not look bad with their entertainment center. Overall they are using it, enjoying it and are very happy with this piece of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Oh H.

customer_reviews.title: Click BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This device is absolutely incredible. Mine came in the mail today and from the time I opened the box to setting up the device and activating my Netflix, and Pandora accounts it took all of 10 min. I was completely stunned. I live in a complex that shares one giant Wi-Fi network so I was a little hesitant about the ease of connection but with no problems Roku picked up the signal and connected almost immediately. I am overwhelmingly impressed with how easy and awesome this device is. If you're looking to by a streaming device this is definitely a top contender. Also, way cheeper (and more accesible) than Apple TV. In my opinion its a cheeper, and better alternative.
customer_reviews.author: L Balzer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to install and do the update on the Roku within 5 or 6 minutes. I have watch several of the instant Netflix shows and the quality is excellent. I have been a long time Netflix user and have watched shows on my laptop but having it on the larger TV screen is just wonderful. I hope to purchase another one soon for an upstairs TV. I will be recommending this to my friends!

product_meta.title: Roku XD 2050, 720p Streaming Player
product_meta.description:
Roku is a little box that allows you to instantly stream tons of entertainment on your TV. Watch over 100,000 movies and TV shows from Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, and more. Listen to music on Pandora, or listen to your own iTunes playlists. Even watch major sports, news, or original Internet programming. It's all available whenever you want it. The all new Roku XD delivers the highest quality HD video, in the smallest box, at the lowest price. No wonder Roku is the best selling streaming player ever.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Roku is a little box that allows you to instantly stream tons of entertainment on your TV. Watch over 100,000 movies and TV shows from Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, Hulu Plus and more. Listen to music on Pandora, or listen to your own iTunes playlists. Watch major sports, news, or original Internet programming. It's all available whenever you want it.

The all-new Roku XD delivers the highest quality HD video, in the smallest box, at the lowest price. No wonder Roku is the best selling streaming player ever.

 * Works with any TV -- up to 1080p*. Roku delivers biggest and best streaming video experience you can get
 * It's really easy. Be up and running in 5 minutes. Roku works with any TV.
 * No PC needed. Roku connects to your high speed Internet connection wirelessly. With the XD, you get extended-range Wireless-N performance.
 * No extra monthly bills. Use your existing subscriptions (like Netflix or Hulu Plus), or enjoy free and on-demand content (like Pandora, Flickr, and Amazon Instant Video).
 * It's always getting better. Roku is constantly expanding its library of streaming entertainment, so there will always be something new to watch.






WHAT CAN YOU DO WITH ROKU?
ROKU SIMPLY BRINGS THE LARGEST SELECTION OF STREAMING ENTERTAINMENT CHOICES TO YOUR TV.
Over 100,000 movies and TV shows to watch instantly— from Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, Hulu Plus and more.

Premium sports. The top leagues like Major League Baseball and the National Hockey League. The main events from UFC and more.

The best tunes. Personalized music from Pandora or MOG, your own iTunes playlists, or radio from around the world.

Plus, tons of other choices, from major network news and original programming to photo and video sharing. More are added every day, so your Roku will always have the most, and the best, in instant entertainment.

NETFLIX AND ROKU: THE ORIGINAL INSTANT MOVIE PARTNERSHIP
Over two years after the launch of the first Roku Netflix player, Roku still delivers the best combination of streaming movie performance and price. With your Netflix membership, browse and search over 20,000 movies and TV episodes to watch whenever you want. The exclusive Instant Replay button lets you skip back instantly to replay that line you just missed. Plus, there are no extra monthly or yearly fees.

ROKU XD = TOP VIDEO PERFORMANCE
Step up with the Roku XD and get more. Up to 1080p high-definition streaming video*. Extended range Wireless-N technology, so you can get it almost anywhere in your house. We even added an Instant Replay button, so you can skip back instantly in 10 second jumps. It's the only streaming player that can do it.





HOW ROKU WORKS
SETTING UP ROKU IS AS EASY AS 1-2-3

Sometimes that doesn't work, and you must restart the Roku box itself - you then discover that the Roku box does not have an on/off switch - you must pull the power cord out and re-attach it.
